entry.title: About me
entry.summary: Bio I am an Invited Assistant Professor at Instituto Superior Técnico - Universidade de Lisboa, researcher at the Distributed Systems Group (GSD) of INESC-ID and a member of DCentral. I have a BSc and a MSc in Informatics Engineering from Faculdade de Ciências da Universidade…
entry.content:
Bio

I am an Invited Assistant Professor at Instituto Superior Técnico - Universidade de Lisboa, researcher at the Distributed Systems Group (GSD) of INESC-ID and a member of DCentral. 

I have a BSc and a MSc in Informatics Engineering from Faculdade de Ciências da Universidade de Lisboa and a PhD in Computer Sciences and Engineering from Instituto Superior Técnico. 

As a researcher I participated in the following projects: PATI, SITAN, SafeClou, SEAL and BIG ERA Chair.

My research interests are related with distributed systems, cybersecurity and cloud. More specifically, I have been researching novel intrusion recovery methods for applications and systems running in the cloud environment. 

Selected Publications

  • David Matos, Miguel Pardal, Miguel Correia
    Sanare: Pluggable Intrusion Recovery for Web Applications.
    IEEE Transactions on Dependable and Secure Computing (TDSC), 2021
    📄PDF
  • David Matos, Miguel Pardal, Georg Carle, and Miguel Correia
    RockFS: Cloud-backed File System Resilience to Client-Side Attacks
    In Proceedings of the 2018 ACM/IFIP/USENIX International Middleware Conference, Dec. 2018
    📄PDF 𐄁 📦Code 𐄁 Slides 𐄁 Video
  • David Matos, Miguel Pardal, and Miguel Correia
    Rectify: Black-Box Intrusion Recovery in PaaS Clouds
    In Proceedings of the 2017 ACM/IFIP/USENIX International Middleware Conference, Dec. 2017
    📄PDF 𐄁 📦Code
  • David Matos, Miguel Correia
    NoSQL Undo: Recovering NoSQL Databases by Undoing Operations
    In Proceedings of the 15th IEEE International Symposium on Network Computing and Applications (NCA), Nov. 2016
    📄PDF 𐄁 📦Code

entry.title: Projects
entry.summary: BIG RaaS - Recovery as a Service Under development The Recovery as a Service project will focus on the development of novel techniques and mechanisms to recover from intrusions in public clouds. These mechanisms take into account the constraints of public clouds like: the incapacity…
entry.content:
BIG

RaaS - Recovery as a Service

Under development

The Recovery as a Service project will focus on the development of novel techniques and mechanisms to recover from intrusions in public clouds. These mechanisms take into account the constraints of public clouds like: the incapacity to modify the source code of the platform, since it is maintained by a third party and provided to users as a service; the heterogeneity of the different cloud service models, which makes it infeasible to adopt a single solution that fits all use cases; the existence of a third party that manages and maintains the cloud platform, restricting the control of the platform.

The RaaS project was submitted to the FCT 2020 Call for SR&TD Project Grants with an overall rating of 7.0. It will be resubmitted to the next call in 2021.



Safecloud

SEAL
